name: Smurfit Kappa Group
goal:
Smurfit Kappa strives to be a
customer-oriented, market-led company where
the satisfaction of customers, the personal
development of employees and respect for the
environment are seen as being inseparable from
the aim of creating value for the shareholders.

Smurfit Kappa is a world leader in paper-based packaging.
The Group operates in 22 countries in Europe and
is the European leader in containerboard, solidboard,
corrugated and solidboard packaging and has a key
position in several other paper packaging market
segments. The Group also operates in 13 countries in
the Americas. Smurfit Kappa is active in the USA, Canada and 11 countries of Latin America.
interests: Business and Industry, Climate Action, Competition, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Environment, Food Safety, Regional Policy, Single market
euInitiatives:
SKG closely follows developments regarding the policy framework for climate and energy, the circular economy and waste and waste recovery. We have a keen interest in ETS III, ETS IV, fossil CO2 emission reduction targets and legislation regarding the use of renewable energy.
We believe that European climate change policies should not be tightened in the absence of international agreements. We therefore recommend that the EU gives greater priority to improving the overall competitive situation of industry in Europe towards which lowering energy prices forms an important step. In general we favour policies that promote the circular economy concept and stimulate the recovery of waste paper. Waste paper or recovered paper as it is called in our industry is the basis raw material for our base product which is paper produced on the basis of recovered papers (fibres).
